intro: Pochota flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered pochota, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
